reviews.title: Very pleased with this Hotel
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel at a very economical price in a very good location between the garden Section and only a block from the streetcar running to the French quarter. The owner is extremely friendly and helpful, and there is an excellent breakfeast as well. Finally the hotel has character and is fun to stay at.

reviews.title: Awesome hotel in the heart of New Orleans
reviews.text: This was an excellent hotel. The price was just perfect and we thouroughly enjoyed our stay. The owner's of the hotel are always within reach and that is saying something for a hotel these days. My husband and I stayed for our 4 year anniversary and I plan to return for a baby shower in New Orleans Labor Day weekend and look forward to another visit to the Prytania. We only hope to get to stay in a loft room this time as there are a couple more in our party. What a pleasant stay and the rooms are absolutely adorable. The old-world charm and stmosphere is abosuletly wonderful. I am glad we got to experience this hotel and hope to make it a tradition upon upcoming visits to New Orleans.

reviews.title: great rooms and lots of good places to eat
reviews.text: I stayed at the Prytania Park Hotel for the second time in 6 months. We have relatives in the city who recomend the Prytania. What a wonderful stay. The hotel is a simple hotel set in the Garden District less than a block from a street car stop. They have wonderful restaurants just a few blocks away. My wife and I decided to go to Bravo's on this trip. What a fantastic meal. We were able to walk there in less than 5 minutes and it was probably one of the best meals of our lives. No kidding. We had wonderful steaks, a fantastic lobster bisque and a creme brulee to die for. We got out for less than $55.00 without drinks. We also ate at Voodoo Barbeque and it was great. Have the pulled pork, corn pudding and chocolate cake. Delicious. It was less than a block from Prytania Park. I had to attend to business while in New Orleans, and I had left my laptop at the airport. The great front desk clerk, made multiple calls to the airport and found my laptop which was delivered before my meeting. A clean comfortable room with attentive staff. We can't wait to return.

reviews.title: Prytania Park is great, swamp tour rules.
reviews.text: My wife and I checked in after horrible delays at 2 different airports. New Orleans was our last stop on a 7 mth vacation. When we checked in we were greeted by a friendly and knowledgable staff. We checked into a wonderful two level "loft" room which had great space for our daughters who are attending school in New Orleans. We were thrilled with the price. Just $99.00 for a weekend night! Downtown hotels were $180.00 and up for the same nights! The room was both clean and inviting. The continental breakfast on the first morning was simple yet high quality. We ate outside in the wonderful courtyard which we just loved. On our second morning we went to the Blue Plate Cafe which was only a block away. What a delcious breakfast. It was one of the best breakfasts of our entire stay. One of the front desk agents also suggested Copeland's Cheesecake Bistro. We had serious complaints about that place. It was just too much delicious cajun food! Many other restaurants were also just an easy walk away. We picked up the streetcar just a block away and took it to Bourbon Street. The wonderful front desk staff also suggested the Cajun Pride Swamp tour. That was the best time. Drinking a daiquiri and watching gators. We had never seen a gator before except on a belt. Would we recomend the Prytania? Absolutely! Wonderful staff, clean rooms and good location. We enjoyed it so much my daughter is now planning her wedding at the Queen Anne mansion which the hotel also owns. A wonderful memorable stay.

reviews.title: A Terrible Disappointment
reviews.text: We found the Prytania from the web on Hotels.com. The photos on the web showed a quaint and authentic New Orleans style hotel - just what I was looking to stay in for my first time to the city. My husband and I arrived with our two small children shortly after midnight. Driving up to the hotel, the surrounding area was a bit ominous. I thought we were staying in the Garden District? I guess they meant “almost” in the Garden District. We checked in and went up to our room exhausted from our long drive and ready to retire. Being so late we requested a different room. Although this one was cleaner than the first, it was still unacceptable. You say my standards are high? Well maybe, but let me just mention a few things I noticed and you be the judge. 1. Thick dust collected on the curtains 2. Wallpaper peeling off the walls. 3. Water stains on the ceiling. 4. Hairs on the floor in the bathroom. 5. The loft bedding was soiled with stains on the inner blanket and what I can only describe as dried up goop on the sheets. (I always pull back sheets to check for stains and bed bugs – Thank God I did) 6. I killed to small baby roaches in the bathroom/kitchen area (the dormitory size refrigerator and coffee maker are behind the bathroom door). Note: The room was cramped with all the furniture and if you are on the heavy side do not request the loft room. The spiral stairs are quite narrow even for someone of average weight and height.

We just returned from a two night stay at the Prytania Park Hotel. We got a terrific rate by booking directly with the hotel using the "Summer Sizzle" discount. We had a loft room with two queen sized beds offering some privacy for more than one traveler. The hotel staff was wonderful. They allowed us to check in early and, in order to accommodate our late flight, leave our bags after checking out. Housekeeping was excellent. A light continental breakfast is served each morning. The hotel is right off the St. Charles streetcar line and very convenient for getting around without a car. On our next trip to New Orleans we would definitely stay at the Prytania Park again.
reviews.title: A Lot of Bang for your Buck!
Good value in lower Garden District
reviews.text: Rooms are small and housekeeping a B-, but the location is great, right on streetcar line, and (despite other reviews) good restaurants nearby.

reviews.title: Hauntingly Beautiful
reviews.text: great gumbo at St. Charles Tavern, Emeril's Delmonico, Copelands's, La Madelines, all within 4 blocks. Free parking in guarded lot! Continental breakfast is minimal, but got a mini-suite (read microwave & small fridge) for $59 by booking directly with the hotel! Hard to beat when compared to French Quarter or Warehouse district. Staff very good with directions & advice. Certainly not elegant, but a bargain none-the-less.

reviews.title: Okay to stay if other options not available
reviews.text: My mother and I stayed at the Prytania Park Hotel and we had an unforgettable time. The hotel had only one room available yet we never saw any other people other than the cleaning ladies and staff in the front office. Our room was truly private (3-4 flights of spiral staircases up...What a workout!!)...the room looked like the inside of a dollhouse...it almost felt creepy but beautiful...very New Orleans like...the walls were painted pink with all sorts of Victorian scenes...so so feminine...our bathroom was very spacious with a very clean bathtub, floors, and sink. We also had a huge wooden closet...I would truly recommend this hotel for someone who is on a budget yet wants to experience New Orleans as it should be

reviews.title: Perfect for the price
reviews.text: First visit to NO during a very busy convention so available hotels were hard to come by. I booked online through expedia and thought I secured a suite at the hotel. Upon checkin I was advised that there were no longer suites available (I did PAY IN ADVANCE through expedia) and I would have to take a standard room. It was late and after a 10 hour trip I took what I could get. The rooms are small!!! The "kitchen" is a very old microwave and a bar fridge. The bathroom is very small as well.

reviews.title: Upscale Hostel - No "boutique" hotel
reviews.text: I reserved through Hotwire, and was expecting a 3star boutique hotel in New Orleans - get the picture?? This is more of an upscale hostel, period. The next door buildings and empty lots give the property a terrible aspect, not to mention that they don't face the street. The layout plan of the hotel, although open, could be disturbing as people walk frequently in front of your rooms ... all windows face the open hallways. The free breakfast in the "lobby" was just a table, with no space to sit and very few options. I don't know who gave the star rating to this place, this person should go back to training !! Beds were small, sheets and bedding were not new, bathrooms were too small and old looking, although everything was very clean.

The place is nice, for an upscale hostel, friendly people, most guests are young people, many Europeans. One block away is St. Charles Avenue, which is a whole new different world, convenient to the street cars.
reviews.title: Be Sure To Check Out Your Room Before You Leave With The Owner/Manager!!!!!

reviews.text: I wouldn't stay here for the full-rate, no way! With discount, I might again.
reviews.title: satisfied

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our credit card was charged $100.00 for a "supposedly cold wet spot on the carpet" WITHOUT OUR KNOWLEDGE after we checked out. We did have an ice chest that had no drainage outlet - but it was completely empty!!!! and left in the bathroom.......the night clerk could verify this........ the manager/owner has decided that we are not telling the truth because "we are college students" and she has one herself. All we can say it that in spite of the fact that the window air condition leaked all over our clothes that were on top of a suitcase - we left the room WITHOUT a large cold wet spot. The manager/owner said that this spot was discovered when the next guests were arriving and then she said it was discovered when the maids called her to ask her what this spot was on the floor - so what was the time lapse????
reviews.title: Terrible - I cannot believe they are still in business

reviews.text: For a hotel to charge $100.00 for a large cold wet spot on the floor - not knowing who put it there - just assuming - and not even giving us the courtesy of letting us know that we are not only being accused - but charged - tells us that this place is one we will tell everyone about - and NOT only other college students!!! PLEASE READ THE OTHER REVIEWS - THEY SAY ALOT!!!!
reviews.title: horrible hotel experience

reviews.text: Ok in fairness it was very very hot when i visited new orleans but a freind and I got into our room and it was split level.one bedroom downstairs with kitchenette.bathroom and then a spiral staircase upstairs.Went upstairs to look but the heat was unbearable despite aircon downstairs so deceided to sleep downstairs.Room was quite cramped with 2 people and suitcases and hard to carry luggage up several flights of stairs.The location was not that great either-had to bus to get anywhere but the good news was the hosts were excellent and nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: southern charm!

likes.liked: — the hosts made you feel like you were a local and one of them.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our trip to New Orleans for the most part was a wonderful experience. The hotel was ok, not what we were expecting but we're not hard to please. The clerk Nicole was a terror. Not only was she rude at times, she got downright nasty with us when we requested more towels. We won't be returning to the hotel ever again because of this.
reviews.title: Disgusting
Worst Hotel Ever
reviews.text: I had made my reservations at this hotel long before Katrina and everyone that I had spoken with was so gracious. Where were they when we came to the hotel? The staff was rude and poorly trained. The girl behind the desk complained about her job and her boss to my husband and I. How unprofessional!! And the rooms we not even nice...our bathroom looked like it hadn't been cleaned since 1992. It was the worst hotel experience of our lives.

reviews.title: a slum at best...
reviews.text: We recently stayed at this hotel for mardi gras. it was god awful. leading up to our stay, we were contacted and asked if we were still coming and that even if we were, there were no rooms....??? the following day, we were contacted again and told that this was a mistake and that the owner said that we could stay...??? once we arrived, what a mess! our room was not clean. they then tried to move us to some slum apartments across the street next to housing projects with several gang people walking around. we were frightened. we refused to accept this abandoned building as our mardi gras getaway and insisted on our prepaid suite. well, they finally said that a mistake had happened that our room was ready after all of our fussing and demanding what we had paid for. when given the keys to our room, we found it had no linen, no towels, the room was still dirty from the previous guest. we went downstairs and complained and were told that housekeeping was gone for the day and that we could clean our own room. thank god for the security guard, he was willing to help us. once our room was cleaned, we left for dinner. when we returned the power was off at the hotel. it remained this way until 11pm. the following morning, we had no hot water. we were told by the staff that the water situation had been this way for over 2 days. we insisted on speaking to the owner. an old senile woman showed up later the next day and just rambled on about how hard she works and what a great job she does as a builder. we were so perplexed, we let the situation go. once we asked the desk who the crazy woman was, he said oh yes, that's the owner. see what we deal with. we will never be back to this hotel again. we are insisting that we receive a refund and have reported this situation to the better business bureau.

reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.text: Stayed at this Hotel in the not too distant past. All those who call this hotel a positive experience are truly out of their minds. The hotel was terrible. The bathroom was dirty and stank. The rugs were old and dilapidated. The mirror was cracked. The walls were thin and the sex-sounds of the couple in the adjoining room were clearly heard. The water was neither hot nor cold. The paint in the rooms was at least a decade old and was peeling. The guest crowd was full of people with an average of 11 tattoos on various parts of their bodies.
